classes.title: ORAD702
classes.subtitle: Advanced Oral Radiologic Technology.  4 Credits.
classes.description: Seminars, laboratory, and clinical sessions to provide experience in advanced oral radiologic procedures.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ORAD704
classes.subtitle: Advanced Radiologic Diagnosis II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Seminars, laboratory, and clinical sessions to provide experience in advanced oral radiologic procedures.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ORAD704
classes.subtitle: Advanced Radiologic Diagnosis II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Literature review, seminars, and clinical experience in advanced radiologic diagnosis.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ORAD705
classes.subtitle: Principles for Advanced Diagnostic and Therapeutic Radiology.  4 Credits.
classes.description: Literature review, seminars, and clinical experience in advanced radiologic diagnosis.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ORAD705
classes.subtitle: Principles for Advanced Diagnostic and Therapeutic Radiology.  4 Credits.
classes.description: Literature review and seminars in the application of radiologic procedures such as computed tomography, digital imaging, and magnetic resonance for diagnosis of oral and maxillofacial conditions. Fundamentals of radiation therapy are also included.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ORAD706
classes.subtitle: Advanced Oral Radiology.  2 Credits.
classes.description: Literature review and seminars in the application of radiologic procedures such as computed tomography, digital imaging, and magnetic resonance for diagnosis of oral and maxillofacial conditions. Fundamentals of radiation therapy are also included.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ORAD706
classes.subtitle: Advanced Oral Radiology.  2 Credits.
classes.description: Radiographic selection criteria, dental radiographs efficacy, panoramic radiology, extraoral techniques, radiation risks and radiological hygiene in dental practice, principle of radiologic interpretation, radiology of cysts and tumors, radiology of the TMJ, radiology of systemic disease, quality improvement, radiology for dental implants, digital imaging in dentistry, and advanced craniofacial region imaging.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ORAD707
classes.subtitle: Graduate Clinical Oral Radiology.  2-6 Credits.
classes.description: Radiographic selection criteria, dental radiographs efficacy, panoramic radiology, extraoral techniques, radiation risks and radiological hygiene in dental practice, principle of radiologic interpretation, radiology of cysts and tumors, radiology of the TMJ, radiology of systemic disease, quality improvement, radiology for dental implants, digital imaging in dentistry, and advanced craniofacial region imaging.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ORAD710
classes.subtitle: Oral and Maxillofacial Radiology Literature Review.  1 Credit.

classes.title: ORAD710
classes.subtitle: Oral and Maxillofacial Radiology Literature Review.  1 Credit.
classes.description: Course is designed for graduate students with a strong interest in OMFR and seeks to expose students to classical articles in the radiology literature.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ORAD802
classes.subtitle: Clinical Radiology Conference.  1 Credit.
classes.description: Course is designed for graduate students with a strong interest in OMFR and seeks to expose students to classical articles in the radiology literature.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ORAD802
classes.subtitle: Clinical Radiology Conference.  1 Credit.
classes.description: Case studies in the interpretation of unusual conditions of the oral and maxillofacial region.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ORAD993
classes.subtitle: Master's Research and Thesis.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Case studies in the interpretation of unusual conditions of the oral and maxillofacial region.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. Grading status: Letter grade.
